text:
Tomorrowland 2025 Mainstage Burned Down Day Before Event; Details Inside
The cause of fire remains under investigation and safety measures are being reviewed by authorities before the arrival of attendees.
In a shocking turn of events, the main stage of the Tomorrowland music festival near Antwerp, Belgium, was completely destroyed by fire on Wednesday. The incident took place just a day before the beginning of the global celebration of electronic dance music. According to local reports and visuals circulating on social media, massive flames and plumes of black smoke engulfed the stage area, reaching the adjacent woodland.
The cause of the fire remains under investigation and authorities are reviewing safety measures. Meanwhile, festival organisers have confirmed that no injuries were reported in the incident and insisted that they will go ahead with the festival over the next two weekends.
Recommended Stories
“Due to a serious incident and fire on the Tomorrowland Mainstage, our beloved Mainstage has been severely damaged," the organisers shared via a post on the event’s website. “We can confirm that no one was injured during the incident," they added.
View this post on Instagram
“We can announce that DreamVille (campsite) will open tomorrow (Thursday, July 17) as planned and will be ready for all DreamVille visitors. All Global Journey activities in Brussels and Antwerp will take place as planned," the statement further read.
Notably, the stage for this year’s event was approximately 147 meters high and 524 meters wide. Additionally, it featured 2,120 atmospheric elements, including 65 water fountains and two waterfalls, as reported by VRT NWS.
As authorities investigate the cause of the blaze, teams on the ground are working swiftly to ensure the safety and enjoyment of attendees set to arrive soon.
Tomorrowland 2025
Often hailed as one of the world’s premier electronic music festivals, Tomorrowland attracts over 4,00,000 visitors annually. This year’s edition was highly anticipated, with top-tier DJs and electronic music stars set to perform from Friday for the first weekend. These stars include David Guetta, Lost Frequencies, Armin Van Buuren and Charlotte de Witte.
Scheduled to start this Friday, July 18, Tomorrowland will reportedly extend through Sunday, July 20. Furthermore, its second weekend will kick off on Friday, July 25, later continuing through the weekend. The lineup for the 19th edition of Tomorrowland also includes the who’s who of global dance music, with artists like Martin Garrix, Steve Aoki, Hardwell, Nervo, John Summit, Fisher, Amelie Lens, Alok, Agents of Time, Miss Monique, The Blessed Madonna joining the event.
